measured_by: continuous post-decision wagering confidence scale (mouse-controlled 0–100 slider with 50 levels per interval)
justification: “The scale used in the actual task had 50 levels per interval… The mouse x-position along the scale was recorded every 200 ms… contributing to the total amount of tokens participants were supposed to maximise,” indicating confidence was captured via a continuous wagering slider.

measured_by: difference between post-exchange and pre-exchange confidence ratings (δC = Cpost − Cpre)
justification: “The influence that social information has on each dyad member can be quantified as the distance between their post-exchange confidence and pre-exchange confidence: δ C = Cpost − Cpre,” showing the construct is operationalised by this difference score.

“A third and final measure of performance considered was the calibration of confidence relative to objective accuracy, defined here as the type II A ROC,” specifying the metric used to gauge calibration.

“By solving the equation for p_p… we can infer the perceived partner's confidence p_p… Comparing the distribution of these values across trials reveals how… social information… is perceived and acted on,” clarifying that p_p quantifies the weight participants give to advice.

measured_by: correct vs. incorrect responses in the two-alternative perceptual discrimination task
justification: “Analyses were performed to assess how social exchange… affected dependent variables of interest: confidence, accuracy and confidence-to-accuracy calibration… Social information had a beneficial effect on average accuracy,” indicating accuracy was measured by correctness on the task.
